page.title: 12UNIVERSITY FARM NEAR LEW
page.content: The farm and old farmhouse were purchased from{University College, {Oxford}in{1959.}It is a dairy farm of 216 acres with 175 acres of cultivated pasture and 40 acres{Winter Wheat. {Forage Rye & Turnips}are grown as a part of crop rotation. Each of the 116 cows is expected to produce{5,500 litres of milk annually. The cows are milked twice daily in a 12/12 {Herringbone Milking Parlour.}Their feed is{computer controlled}by a two_way transmitter worn around their necks. Each cow receives exact amount selected by farmer. Any cows not feeding correctly appear on printout and can be checked.{60 dairy calves are bred each year by artificial insemination to replace old stock. The other cows mate with the farm's {Charollais Bull}for beef production. Milk quotas are strictly applied.
